channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Balls being kicked into cars and property, 23rd October
item.description:
The kids keep kicking balls into cars,garage doors,and fences and kitchen windows. All the people down the road have tried to speak to them as our property is getting damaged but they continue. They will kick balls at passing cars as well,it's getting dangerous. This has been going on for several years during the warmer months.i have lots of images on my cctv of their behaviour. I feel its in the neighbourhoods safety if a "no ball games signs" was imposed. This tend to happen right in front of 21 Windyridge gardens and a few house alongside. The police have been informed and they have issued warning letters around the area about anti-social behaviour,but it does not stop them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 109, Windyridge Gardens, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light is permanently out problem, 22nd October
item.description:
Streetlight Light is permanently out Web Reference: LSS008713 Enquiry Number: 11437337 Hi The issue with 4-5 lights being out on greyhound gardens was reported the start of September, in I phone call I was advised these would be fixed 16th October but they are still not working, they have now been out since around July, please can you advise why they weren’t fixed last week as advised and when they will be fixed, there are a lot of elderly who walk their dogs and for there to be no lights in this area is extremely dangerous, please advise Regards Nicky Wilson
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree in its last year or two of safe life, 22nd October
item.description:
On the corner of Leckhampton Views with Leckhampton Road - on the north corner. A tree with a substantial hole in the bole near the base. This tree's foliage was seen to be turning yellow more quickly than that of its neighbours. The hole has been there for a long time, but is at last probably reducing supply of nutrients. This has got worse since the new cul-de-sac was opened - a portion of green verge was lost thereby - and presumably some water supply and nutrients to the roots were reduced. Some branches have had bare twigs this year. It will be a shame to see another giant felled - but this one, among others, is becoming a potential threat to passers-by and road users.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 214, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 22nd October
item.description:
Trees Causing damage/obstruction to pavement/road There are several trees that have been damaged on recent weather. One is leaning into the road and I just witnessed a car who was close to the edge hit it and have the car damaged. It needs removing before further accidents happen.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obstruction caused by wall/building problem, 21st October
item.description:
Reporting:obstruction_caused_by_tree The new cycle path doesn’t run to Gotherington and exits in the most dangerous point on the road requiring cyclists to cross at the most dangerous point
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree location tarmaced over, 21st October
item.description:
The location of the mature cheery tree which was recently been felled has been tarmaced over rather than being replaced. This is not in keeping with the rest of the street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Cleeve View Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
